meanings.definition: To bid more than the actual value of something in an auction.
meanings.sent1: She always overbids on items at auctions, thinking they are worth more.
meanings.sent2: During the auction, he overbids to ensure he wins the item he wants.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic bidder accidentally overbids on a small vase, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: In the heat of the auction, she overbids like there's no tomorrow, caught up in the excitement.
meanings.sent5: His tendency to overbid makes him stand out as a passionate collector in the auction world.

meanings.definition: To make a higher bid than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He always overbids to outdo his competitors in the bidding war.
meanings.sent2: In the final moments, she strategically overbids to secure the winning bid.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully overbid each other in a friendly competition for a painting.
meanings.sent4: She overbids confidently, knowing she has the financial edge over the other bidders.
meanings.sent5: The determined buyer overbids, determined to walk away with the prized possession.

meanings.definition: An offer to pay more than the asking price for something.
meanings.sent1: His overbid on the house surprised the sellers but sealed the deal.
meanings.sent2: The generous overbid on the antique table impressed the seller with its value.
meanings.sent3: The overbid on the car made the salesman raise an eyebrow at the buyer's eagerness.
meanings.sent4: She made an overbid on the painting, showing her appreciation for fine art.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected overbid on the necklace left the auctioneer pleasantly surprised.
